title: Tamil Nadu: Opposition stages massive protest over Mekedatu project on Cauvery river
title_page: Tamil Nadu: Opposition stages massive protest over Mekedatu project on Cauvery river - India News
text:
Opposition parties in Tamil Nadu came together for a massive protest against the proposed project on Cauvery river near Mekedatu in Karnataka.
The protest, led by Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK), saw leaders from parties such as MDMK, VCK, TVK, Congress and the Left sharing stage with DMK president MK Stalin.
Karnataka and Tamil Nadu are locked in the water dispute for decades.
Karnataka plans to build a reservoir on Cauvery river near Mekedatu. The project was first proposed in 2013. It received cabinet approval in 2017.
On November 22, Central Water Commission (CWC) gave a go-ahead to Karnataka Neeravari Nigam Limited for preparation of a detailed project report for Mekedatu Balancing Reservoir and drinking water project.
Tamil Nadu has maintained that the project will affect water flow in Cauvery.
The Opposition protested against the Centre's green signal to the project.
"There should be no more dams. This is the Karnataka government's ploy," said A Sarvanan of DMK.
He said that if Karnataka goes ahead with the project, Tamil Nadu won't get water to irrigate the delta region in the state.
However, Karnataka government says that the project will be beneficial for Tamil Nadu, too, and is essential for providing drinking water to Bengaluru and Ramanagar.
There was anger among Tamil Nadu farmers after the Centre gave a go-ahead to Karnataka. Farmers in Trichy took to the streets and burnt Prime Minister Narendra Modi's effigy.
After Tuesday's protests, BJP accused opposition parties of creating tension in the state by saying that the project has got a go-ahead from the Centre.
AIADMK has already moved the Supreme Court and the party has said that it stands by the people of Tamil Nadu while accusing DMK of hypocrisy.
"We strongly condemn DMK and allies for trying to mislead the public. It is the Congress in Karnataka which supports the JD(S). Congress and DMK are allies for upcoming elections. Stalin does not have the guts to condemn Congress government. AIADMK will stand with the people and will fight the issue tooth and nail", said Kovai Sathyan, spokesperson of the AIADMK.
